captions.text:
Chris, it looks like you're
struggling to paint.
It says it all right here.

[sigh]
You can always read me like a painting, Chris.

I'm not following you...
on Twitter.

-Chris, I'm going to teach you how to paint.
-Why?

Because I want to build the only kind of ship
that doesn't sink.

-Chris I want you to paint me.
-Done.

That is a shoe.
You have painted a shoe.
Damn, it must be this brush!

I imagined you being
Chinese this time...

That is still a shoe, yet
somehow more racist.

-Damn this xenophobic brush!
-Only a bad workman blames his tools.
Now is not the time for feminism, Chris.
WHEN WILL IT BE TIME, TOM?
Hnnrrggh, it's just so hard, Tom!
You've got to believe in yourself, Chris!
Can't. I can't do it, Tom. I can't.

It's...nothing! It's...
It's just a work in progress.

What did I tell you
about feminism?!

Tom, I do not respect your
misogynistic criticisms.

-I'll kill you, Chris
-Not if I kill myself first.
Two can play at that game...

They must have painted
their killers before they died.

So we're looking for a centaur,
an anti-semitic cat,
Hey, you! So that was a video!

I hope you enjoyed it and you should
check out my last two videos over here.

Or you could subscribe to my channel
Crabstickz!

It's like what Tom does, but a bit...
a bit lighter!
Tell them to subscribe to my channel, Tom!

comments.author: ‫גיל שטראחמן‬‎

comments.text:
+גיל שטראחמן  
"He's thinking about the Holocaust!"
"Now I hate it."
Tom is against antisemitism in this quote, which means he's being 
unprejudiced to the millions of Jews that died during the Holocaust.
In other words, he hates the picture because it's prejudiced against the 
Jews, meaning he doesn't hate them.


But please remember this is comedy, none of this is real and should not be 
taken seriously.
